ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yes I would recommend the course.
Yes, recommended unconditionally as a core course in political economy. However, the course is very hard for students who have not completed the microeconomics sequence yet.
I would recommend the course to any student interested in Political Economy and the relationship between economic and political institutions.
this course requires a lot of familiarity with advanced microeconomics. if you haven't had this, the course probably is not for you.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course enabled me to move beyond consuming formal models and gave me the training and structure I needed to think through developing my own. By the end of the course I had two concrete research ideas, related to my potential dissertation topic, that I can work on.
The course helped expose me to a much wider and more interesting set of readings on authoritarian government and transitions.
